subject: Public Speaking
title: The Amygdala Hijack
description: A quick win: understand The Amygdala Hijack.

hook.text: You've prepared perfectly. You step on stage. Your mind goes blank. Your amygdala just hijacked you.

buildup.text: The amygdala is a small almond-shaped structure that processes threats faster than your conscious brain can think.

discovery.text: It triggers fight-or-flight in milliseconds, flooding your body with adrenaline before you realize why.

twist.text: The prefrontal cortex â€” your thinking brain â€” gets temporarily sidelined. That's why you forget your lines.

climax.text: An amygdala hijack isn't a character flaw. It's a neural circuit doing exactly what evolution designed it to do.

punchline.text: Your brain chose survival over your speech.

quiz.question: What happens during an amygdala hijack on stage?
options: The threat response overrides your thinking brain
